newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican tequila magnate murdered in his car.
newsitem.headline: Mexican tequila magnate murdered in his car.

text.p: Mexican tequila magnate Jesus Lopez Roman was shot in the head and killed on Tuesday in his car, the state attorney general's office said.
"He was assasinated this morning ... the victim of various shots from 0.45 and 0.38 caliber pistols when in his car," the statement said.
Local media reports said he was shot 13 times total from both pistols while in a one-year-old BMW.
Lopez Roman, about 54 years old, was owner of tequila brands Tequila San Matias and Tequila Pueblo Viego.
Last year his company ranked fifth in national sales and sixth in exports of tequila made 100 percent from agave, the cactus-like plant that produces the potent drink.
Police said three or four gunmen fled the scene in a stolen car.
"It is still being investigated whether the crime was because the victim resisted the theft of his car or if there was another motive," the statement said.
